results.title: Watch the Stars of ‘Tenet’ Leap Tall Buildings
results.abstract: The writer-director Christopher Nolan discusses a scene that follows John David Washington and Robert Pattinson’s characters as they’re launched up the side of a tower. The movie is now available on demand.

results.abstract: Frederick Wiseman’s documentary films offer an unparalleled, panoramic vision of society. His 45th feature, “City Hall,” is on PBS this month — and he’s eager to get back to work.
results.title: What if the Great American Novelist Doesn’t Write Novels?
How the Bee Gees Stayed Alive
results.abstract: The HBO documentary “The Bee Gees: How Can You Mend a Broken Heart” traces the decades-long arc of a band that mastered a rare pop skill: adaptation.
des_facet: The Bee Gees: How Can You Mend a Broken Heart (Movie)

results.abstract: What if you could shoot a complete prototype for a movie? That’s essentially what Michael Mann did with “L.A. Takedown” on NBC.
results.title: ‘Heat’ and the TV Movie That Paved Its Way to Becoming a Classic
New Star of ‘The Prom’ Sees a Chance to Make L.G.B.T.Q. Characters Visible
results.abstract: Like her character, Jo Ellen Pellman identifies as queer, and she is making her film debut in the Netflix musical alongside A-listers like Meryl Streep and Nicole Kidman.

multimedia.caption: “It’s the best feeling in the world knowing I can bring my authentic self to the role,” Jo Ellen Pellman said of “The Prom.”

results.title: 9 Great John le Carré Adaptations to Stream
results.abstract: From the beginning, his novels of Cold War espionage and moral ambiguity attracted leading actors and filmmakers. Here are nine that can be streamed.
